name: Web Development Basics
description: Introduction to the core principles of web development, focusing on client-side and server-side programming.

lessons.name: Introduction to Web Development
lessons.description: Overview of web development technologies and the process of building web applications.

lessons.name: Client-Side Programming
lessons.description: Introduction to HTML, CSS, and JavaScript for building interactive web pages.

lessons.name: Server-Side Programming
lessons.description: Introduction to backend programming using popular web frameworks like Node.js and Express.

lessons.name: Databases in Web Development
lessons.description: Overview of database systems, including SQL and NoSQL, for storing and retrieving data in web applications.

lessons.name: Web Security
lessons.description: Fundamentals of web application security, including common vulnerabilities and best practices for securing applications.

name: Advanced Web Development
description: A deeper dive into advanced web development techniques, including responsive design, web frameworks, and advanced security practices.

lessons.name: Responsive Web Design
lessons.description: Techniques for building websites that work well on both desktop and mobile devices.

lessons.name: Frontend Frameworks
lessons.description: Introduction to modern frontend frameworks like React and Vue.js for building dynamic user interfaces.

lessons.name: Backend Frameworks
lessons.description: In-depth exploration of backend frameworks like Django and Ruby on Rails for building robust web applications.

lessons.name: APIs and Web Services
lessons.description: How to create and consume APIs using REST and GraphQL to enable communication between different parts of a web application.

lessons.name: Advanced Web Security
lessons.description: Advanced topics in web security, including OAuth, JWT, and securing APIs.

name: Introduction to Data Storage Systems
description: An introduction to large-scale data storage systems, including relational and non-relational databases.

lessons.name: Overview of Data Storage Systems
lessons.description: Introduction to different types of data storage systems and their use cases.

lessons.name: Relational Databases
lessons.description: Fundamentals of relational databases, including schema design, normalization, and SQL.

lessons.name: Non-Relational Databases
lessons.description: Introduction to NoSQL databases like MongoDB, Cassandra, and Redis, and their advantages over relational systems.

name: Distributed Storage Systems
description: Exploration of distributed storage systems and their application in handling large-scale data.

lessons.name: Introduction to Distributed Systems
lessons.description: Concepts and architectures of distributed storage systems.

lessons.name: Data Replication and Consistency
lessons.description: Techniques for ensuring data reliability and consistency in distributed systems.

lessons.name: Distributed File Systems
lessons.description: In-depth look at distributed file systems like HDFS and their application in data storage.

name: Query Optimization and Indexing
description: Techniques for optimizing database queries and indexing for efficient data retrieval.

lessons.name: Query Optimization Basics
lessons.description: Techniques and algorithms for optimizing SQL queries to improve performance.

lessons.name: Indexing Strategies
lessons.description: Different indexing methods and their application in improving database query speed.

lessons.name: Advanced Query Optimization
lessons.description: Advanced techniques in query optimization, including cost-based optimization and execution plans.

name: Data Warehousing and ETL Processes
description: An overview of data warehousing concepts and the Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) processes.

lessons.name: Introduction to Data Warehousing
lessons.description: Basics of data warehousing and its importance in large-scale data storage and retrieval.

lessons.name: ETL Process Overview
lessons.description: Detailed exploration of the ETL process and its role in integrating data from multiple sources into a data warehouse.

lessons.name: Data Modeling for Data Warehouses
lessons.description: Techniques for designing efficient data models in data warehouses, including star and snowflake schemas.

name: Introduction to Programming Languages
description: Overview of programming languages, their principles, and the basic concepts that guide their design and implementation.

lessons.name: History of Programming Languages
lessons.description: A brief history of programming languages and how they've evolved over time.

lessons.name: Syntax and Semantics
lessons.description: Understanding the structure (syntax) and meaning (semantics) behind programming languages.

lessons.name: Types and Data Structures
lessons.description: Exploration of data types, type systems, and common data structures used in programming languages.

name: Control Structures and Functions
description: A deep dive into the control structures and functions that define the flow of a program and how they are implemented in different languages.

lessons.name: Control Flow Constructs
lessons.description: Introduction to conditionals, loops, and branching statements in various languages.

lessons.name: Functions and Recursion
lessons.description: Understanding functions, function calls, and recursion as a foundational concept in programming languages.

lessons.name: First-Class Functions
lessons.description: Exploration of languages with first-class functions and higher-order functions.

name: Object-Oriented Programming
description: In-depth exploration of object-oriented programming concepts, including classes, objects, inheritance, and polymorphism.

lessons.name: Classes and Objects
lessons.description: Understanding the fundamentals of classes, objects, and their relationship in object-oriented languages.

lessons.name: Inheritance and Polymorphism
lessons.description: Concepts of inheritance, subclassing, and polymorphism in object-oriented programming.

lessons.name: Encapsulation and Abstraction
lessons.description: How encapsulation and abstraction are used in OOP to improve code structure and flexibility.

name: Design and Implementation of Programming Languages
description: Techniques for designing and implementing new programming languages, with a focus on syntax, semantics, and the interpreter/compiler process.

lessons.name: Language Design Principles
lessons.description: Principles and best practices for designing a new programming language.

lessons.name: Compilers and Interpreters
lessons.description: Introduction to the implementation of compilers and interpreters for programming languages.

lessons.name: Practical Language Design
lessons.description: Hands-on experience in designing a simple programming language and its interpreter.

name: Introduction to Networking
description: Overview of networking fundamentals, including key concepts and network types.

lessons.name: Networking Basics
lessons.description: Introduction to computer networks, types of networks (LAN, WAN, etc.), and their uses.

lessons.name: Network Models
lessons.description: Overview of the OSI and TCP/IP models, their layers, and their role in network communication.

lessons.name: Transmission Media
lessons.description: Types of transmission media used in networks, including copper, fiber optics, and wireless.

name: Network Protocols
description: In-depth exploration of essential network protocols and how they support communication.

lessons.name: TCP/IP Protocol Suite
lessons.description: Understanding the TCP/IP stack and the protocols that work at each layer.

lessons.name: IPv4 and IPv6
lessons.description: Introduction to IP addressing, IPv4 vs IPv6, and how IP addresses are structured and assigned.

lessons.name: DNS and DHCP
lessons.description: How the Domain Name System (DNS) and Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) work to manage network communication.

name: Routing and Switching
description: An overview of routing and switching technologies in networking, including algorithms and devices.

lessons.name: Routing Principles
lessons.description: Fundamentals of routing, including routing tables, protocols (RIP, OSPF), and routing algorithms.

lessons.name: Switching and VLANs
lessons.description: Concepts of Ethernet switching, VLAN configuration, and their use in modern networks.

lessons.name: Routing Protocols and Techniques
lessons.description: A deeper dive into advanced routing protocols, including BGP and advanced configurations.

name: Network Security
description: Principles of securing networks, covering both defensive and offensive strategies.

lessons.name: Introduction to Network Security
lessons.description: Fundamentals of network security, including threats, vulnerabilities, and risk management.

lessons.name: Firewalls and VPNs
lessons.description: Overview of network firewalls, VPNs, and secure tunneling techniques.

lessons.name: Network Intrusion Detection and Prevention
lessons.description: Techniques and tools used for detecting and preventing network intrusions.

name: Introduction to Computer Systems
description: Overview of the basic components of computer systems, including architecture, organization, and operation.

lessons.name: Computer Architecture Basics
lessons.description: Introduction to computer architecture, including the function of major components like the CPU, memory, and I/O devices.

lessons.name: Digital Logic and Gates
lessons.description: Fundamentals of digital logic, Boolean algebra, and logic gates used in computer systems.

lessons.name: Instruction Set Architecture
lessons.description: Understanding the architecture of processors, including instruction formats, addressing modes, and the control unit.

name: Processor Design and Memory Systems
description: In-depth exploration of processor design, memory hierarchies, and cache management.

lessons.name: CPU Design and Execution
lessons.description: Designing and understanding the execution pipeline of a central processing unit (CPU).

lessons.name: Memory Hierarchies
lessons.description: Understanding different levels of memory (registers, cache, RAM) and their role in system performance.

lessons.name: Cache Design and Optimization
lessons.description: Techniques for designing and optimizing memory caches for better system performance.

name: Operating Systems Fundamentals
description: Foundational knowledge of operating systems, including processes, threads, and memory management.

lessons.name: Introduction to Operating Systems
lessons.description: Basic concepts of operating systems, including process management and memory management.

lessons.name: Processes and Threads
lessons.description: Understanding processes and threads, their scheduling, and synchronization in modern operating systems.

lessons.name: Memory Management Techniques
lessons.description: Exploration of memory management strategies such as paging, segmentation, and virtual memory.

name: I/O Devices and System Troubleshooting
description: Study of input/output devices, communication methods, and troubleshooting computer systems.

lessons.name: Input/Output Devices
lessons.description: Study of I/O devices such as keyboards, displays, and storage devices, and their interface with the computer system.

lessons.name: Interrupt Handling
lessons.description: Understanding how interrupt-driven I/O works and its impact on system performance.

lessons.name: Troubleshooting Computer Systems
lessons.description: Techniques for diagnosing and fixing common hardware and software issues in computer systems.

name: Introduction to Object-Oriented Design
description: Fundamentals of object-oriented design, including classes, objects, and basic design principles.

lessons.name: Classes and Objects
lessons.description: Introduction to classes and objects, covering their role in object-oriented programming and design.

lessons.name: Encapsulation and Abstraction
lessons.description: Understanding encapsulation and abstraction in object-oriented design and their importance in software modularity.

lessons.name: Design Principles Overview
lessons.description: Overview of key object-oriented design principles such as SOLID and DRY principles.

name: Inheritance and Polymorphism
description: Detailed study of inheritance and polymorphism as fundamental object-oriented design concepts.

lessons.name: Inheritance Basics
lessons.description: Understanding the concept of inheritance and how it promotes code reusability and hierarchy.

lessons.name: Polymorphism and Method Overriding
lessons.description: Exploring polymorphism, including method overriding and the benefits of runtime flexibility.

lessons.name: Abstract Classes and Interfaces
lessons.description: Study of abstract classes and interfaces, and their role in achieving polymorphism and abstraction in design.

name: Design Patterns
description: Exploration of common design patterns used in object-oriented design to solve recurring design problems.

lessons.name: Introduction to Design Patterns
lessons.description: Overview of common design patterns and their benefits in software design.

lessons.name: Creational Patterns
lessons.description: In-depth study of creational design patterns like Singleton, Factory, and Abstract Factory.

lessons.name: Structural Patterns
lessons.description: Understanding structural design patterns such as Adapter, Bridge, and Composite.

lessons.name: Behavioral Patterns
lessons.description: Study of behavioral patterns like Observer, Strategy, and Command.

name: Modeling and Problem Solving
description: Techniques for modeling real-world problems and designing object-oriented solutions.

lessons.name: Problem Modeling with Objects
lessons.description: How to model real-world problems using classes and objects, and break down complex systems.

lessons.name: Object-Oriented Analysis
lessons.description: Understanding the process of analyzing problems and designing object-oriented solutions.

lessons.name: Case Studies and Solution Implementation
lessons.description: Applying object-oriented design principles to real-world case studies and problem-solving exercises.

name: Introduction to Software Systems
description: Introduction to the principles of software systems, focusing on basic concepts and methodologies used in software development.

lessons.name: Software Development Life Cycle
lessons.description: Overview of the software development life cycle, including requirement gathering, design, implementation, and testing.

lessons.name: Basic Programming Practices
lessons.description: Introduction to programming best practices such as code organization, debugging, and version control.

lessons.name: Collaborative Software Development
lessons.description: Techniques and tools for collaborative software development, focusing on teamwork and communication.

name: Data Structures and Algorithms
description: Focus on fundamental data structures and algorithms, with practical programming assignments and problem-solving techniques.

lessons.name: Introduction to Data Structures
lessons.description: Overview of basic data structures such as arrays, linked lists, and stacks, and their applications in problem-solving.

lessons.name: Sorting and Searching Algorithms
lessons.description: Study of basic algorithms such as quicksort, mergesort, and binary search, including performance analysis.

lessons.name: Algorithm Complexity
lessons.description: Understanding algorithmic complexity, big-O notation, and how to analyze the efficiency of algorithms.

name: Programming Languages and Paradigms
description: Exploration of various programming paradigms and languages, and their use in solving different types of computational problems.

lessons.name: Introduction to Programming Languages
lessons.description: Overview of programming languages, their features, and how they relate to different types of computational problems.

lessons.name: Procedural Programming
lessons.description: Introduction to procedural programming, focusing on control structures, functions, and modular design.

lessons.name: Object-Oriented Programming
lessons.description: Introduction to object-oriented programming (OOP), including classes, objects, inheritance, and polymorphism.

name: Software Development Methodologies
description: Study of software development methodologies, focusing on agile and waterfall models and their applications in real-world projects.

lessons.name: Agile Development
lessons.description: Introduction to agile software development, including Scrum and Kanban frameworks, and iterative development.

lessons.name: Waterfall Methodology
lessons.description: Exploring the waterfall software development model, including its stages and application in large-scale projects.

name: Computational Problem Solving
description: Techniques for solving computational problems, focusing on algorithmic thinking and problem decomposition.

lessons.name: Problem Solving Strategies
lessons.description: Overview of problem-solving techniques such as divide-and-conquer, dynamic programming, and greedy algorithms.

lessons.name: Practice with Data Structures
lessons.description: Hands-on exercises in implementing and using data structures like trees, graphs, and hash tables for solving real-world problems.

lessons.name: Efficient Algorithms
lessons.description: Study of algorithm efficiency, including optimizations for time and space complexity in solving problems.

name: Software Design and Implementation
description: Focus on the design and implementation of software systems, emphasizing modularity, testing, and optimization.

lessons.name: Designing Software Systems
lessons.description: Techniques for designing software systems, including architectural design, design patterns, and code organization.

lessons.name: Implementing Software Solutions
lessons.description: Focus on converting design specifications into code, including implementation best practices and code reviews.

lessons.name: Testing and Debugging
lessons.description: Study of software testing techniques, including unit testing, integration testing, and debugging techniques.
